title: Design Biotop
segmentation: Hi, I'm Sasha and we are from Design View top project.
We call it.
It's actually a platform and we're probably the youngest project in this team.
We started it in 2013 and the point of the platform is to promote design mindset for complex problem solving and that includes everything.
All the all the levels of SoC and the focus that you are trying to do is actually to connect designers, creative individuals, architects.
Whoever that is actually important in his design, making processes that would collaborate with us together with the public sector.
So the innovation, public sector we believe is extremely important.
If you want to achieve bigger social changes in any SoC.
So we are trying to work closely with with public sector and suggesting different approaches and solutions to actually open up topics that would.
Somehow, in the future include creatives in decision making processes, much more actively.
So what we started to do in 2013 is that we kind of brought in Slovenia finish experience.
We called it what Finland did with with integration of design and design mindset in all levels of SoC.
And what we do through the project is that we actually create different workshops lectures where we actively participate in working together across levels of SoC.
So what we did the first year was mostly presenting that there is different approaches existing just to give an example from Marco Steinberg who was also.

So one of the one of the presenters at the first design biotope event that works closely with the government and public sector in stevia in Finland that we're trying to bring system systemic solutions through opening proper questions an.
Advising how complex problems could be solved besides working individually in all our fields.
So Marco Steinberg was a system thinker, also chairman of Architecture Museum in Finland.
So the individuals that we kind of try and connect with public sector and through our activities are the ones who are extremely creative and curious by nature would call them.

And they have this systemic approach in any field they work and they they cannot just work in that field, so they usually jump across fields and they bring very very fresh perspectives in any team that they've become part of.
So the things that we do are.
Are mostly related to too complex problem solving together with the public sector.
So for instance, this year we are creating so called design innovation Challenge.
We have two agencies and for ministries involved and we are connecting very specific individuals from all fields of creative occupations.
If I can call them so widely and also from business and we're bringing them together with public sector individuals from different ministries like Ministry of Culture.
Ministry of Science and Education and so on.
And we are trying to innovate on their own concept that they brought in in the form of briefs.
And we're trying to find better ways or different ways of solving these complex problems.
Why we became part of design via platform is that we last year we worked a lot on the the let's say the value of of culture and all the activities that we all do.
Different fields developed cultures for prosperity and growth of each country in each country in any place, and we did a huge.

Data visualization project with 36 people involved trying to visualize data that we got from data agencies here that was never visualized about the prosperity of culture and creative industries in Slovenia and the outcomes we got were amazing.
They showed a lot of information that was never so clear.
What we are missing in this place like in this country and what the potentials are that we could go into.
So we are extremely interested in this cross fields where where we can bring.
Is different approach this into?
Active participation kind of workshops, lectures and so on.
So for for design bio.
Top in the project of Atura.

We are looking for finding specific individuals from our partners who would participate in activities that would lead into let's say innovating with public sector and trying to figure out how specific projects could be.
Implemented and realized not only in this country, but throughout all of our places that we are part of.
This is like a short presentation.
Um?
The background of design biotop is.
Also that has organization.
We do a lot of different platforms.

I would just show you one is called independent Daniel since 2007 and we're bringing young people from design and art working together through transition plenary nature of of contemporary illustration.
But we also had people from all fields.
It's not just art or design like as a classical form of being a painter or designer, a graphic designer.
It's very open.
So what we?
Do is we?
We try and bring people together that would usually never meet and that is what we do in all projects and platforms that we are building.
Um, we we work a lot also.
If it's internationally.
We're bringing.
A lot of workshops, an guests that guide our.
Content together with us.
Ah.

And also, for instance, we're doing a lot of online exchanges, for instance, one example was working remotely between Slovenia and Finland on different technology based solutions and this year we're doing the same interaction with New York based collectives.
So it's also a lot about bringing different cultural backgrounds and people with different experiences together to exchange their knowledge and to find.

Like new ideas of further credibility collaborations, so our our goal in what we do is not only about as being the final result, but about suggesting these people who meet maybe person through us to continue working once we are gone from the picture.
Because that's also part of let's say a good good platform.
We are mostly oriented into newcomers in all fields.
Most of the people that we collaborate on different platforms are probably between 20 something to 40 years old.
That's like a average year, but we are open cross generation, cross everything so.
But we do a lot of supports to newcomers because that's usually the hardest step you have to do before your career.
And for your life moves on.
Um, so these are just a few examples that I'm showing about different workshops and an things we were doing.
In a lot of talks, a lot of practical examples also from from.
Let's say this environment in 15 minutes talks.

For instance, we presented a lot of at that point very specific project that came to live like one of them was Nordic was a fitness center that you probably heard about like Space Technology Center in Slovenia, Space Technologies and Arts.
And we always try and also showcase the examples that are worth mentioning to wider public, public or wider SoC.
Um?
We also work outside of Slovenia.
We merge with with the Intrapreneurship program for kids for underprivileged youth.
For instance in Indonesia.
And then we're trying to bring creative mindset and skills that we gained here across two different groups of individuals who might need.
As many different skills as possible to have more opportunities in their lives, so this is something that is going beyond European borders.
So if I go.
Go back to the beginning too.
Biotop, we hope that we can find a lot of new ideas.
What we can bring into discussions through sectors through this project and we hope that this is also something that we can gain through knowing new partners.
So thank you.
